attributes.content: Central District
A short while before

attributes.options: How are you certain Amiya's group will reach the command tower...
...without crossing one of Talulah's elite squads?

attributes.content: This is the problem with conspirators.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Take a warlord, or a tyrant of a devious king. Their strongholds are always easy to defend, hard to attack.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They know their own deeds will invite furious retribution without fail. They'll use superior strength and advanced armaments to deploy unyielding defense.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yet, seeing as Talulah's despotic behavior is confirmed to be some kind of act, she would not do things this way.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: What makes you so confident?;......;I wanna hear your reasoning.

attributes.content: Experience, theory, phenomena.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I have no confidence. I can only derive the facts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Truthfully, I'm hoping to see you ever offer your own opinion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Or maybe you're already content with silence as a brand of opinion?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Then I thank you for your understanding.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If my thought process was one that won your approval...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Did you think that I would thus feel some kind of happy?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Respect is a two-way street. If you value my point of view, and arrive at any useful conclusions, then I in turn will give your point of view serious consideration.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Talulah is maintaining her own image. She needs to have the normal Infected respect her, have the Sarkaz mercenaries obey her, have the guerrillas trust her, have the zealots worship her...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She needs to have the distance between her and them clearly visible, and have these people able to examine each other.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: According to a series of behavior exhibited by Reunion so far, we can very clearly realize that Reunion's other leaders do not particularly recognize Talulah's conduct at all.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even Patriot, seeing through to her scheme, had no power to reverse the tide in the middle of its change. If he could have killed Talulah, all the same, he still would have been unable to alter Reunion tending towards collapse.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: To say nothing of the plot to exploit the Infected that Talulah has drawn up inside her own head... The time she would need likely far exceed the time Reunion has existed so far.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I conjecture that all of Reunion's actions up to now have been premised on a plan. Namely...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: 'Reunion will perish after all this is over.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Talulah will scatter keen, hidden forces across every part of her territory. When she needs them, she'll assemble them, and have them make their appearance at the right moment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, I believe the Empire of Ursus's Third Army would not permit any Infected to act freely whatsoever.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: However, Reunion's current conduct is all within the bounds of their tolerance. Superficial violence, lacking discipline and organization. The Third Army must be happy to see it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Think about it carefully. Would they limit themselves to being onlookers? Thus, would they risk truly, willingly letting Talulah control a whole city—even a whole country's state of affairs?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Or perhaps, even this is one of the weights on Talulah's scales, used to swindle the Ursus military out of their power... having them hibernate somewhere, waiting until the situation is just about to move on from her control.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And then, in the truest sense, she'll be able to use... the power she could never even touch. Just as she wishes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But that needs time.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Now that you say all that, how is she not a tyrant?

attributes.content: Because while current Reunion wants that in a leader, it doesn't truly need that in a leader.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A tyrant treasures one's own enablers, even if a tyrant more often than not recklessly destroys them for lack of foresight or composure, and weeps truest, deepest tears for it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A conspirator does not. The tyrant has chess pieces, and the conspirator does too; but the tyrant is with them on the chessboard, while the conspirator sits outside of it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We can suppose she has humanity, and thus might make mistakes. But if we're talking about a qualified conspirator with a scheme on the tracks, then even if she herself died, her scheme would continue as a matter of course.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If they were, we'd hardly be taking Rhodes Island's operators to hell and back.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The only thing naturally useless is killing her. So, in every part and every place, we must break down her plot, antagonize her instructions, and lead her scheme to failure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If we cannot halt a landship's forward march, then we will tear it to pieces, and make it arrive at its destination no more than an empty carapace.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Ah, maybe I shouldn't have put it to you like that. Don't get me wrong, we still need to stop this Chernobog core city.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, you've worried about whether or not Amiya's group will run into any incidents...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I think what's on show before us is the real incident, here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: W, W. Where W? W stronger.
attributes.name: Herdified Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Don't, don't enter...
attributes.name: Herdified Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: (A certain Sarkaz tribe's language)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Underground full of darkness. Darkness create evil. Evil bring pain.
attributes.name: Herdified Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: Too much, pain.
attributes.name: Herdified Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: (A certain Sarkaz tribe's language)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Will you, share our pain?
attributes.name: Herdified Sarkaz Warrior

attributes.content: No luck. Even if they weren't born in Kazdel, they should still have some kind of reaction to a hint of their native language. Their ability to actively think has been damaged.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Could those words you were saying have any effect on them?

attributes.content: They were meant to in the first place.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No, wait... this wasn't a common-sense idea. Don't get excited.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But if not even this lets me rouse their conscious, then they've already lost all capacity for thought, beyond simply their ability to express.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It means their brain's activity has been sealed off, or that their nervous system has been perturbed by the infected organs... either way, we don't have enough time left to ascertain the true answer.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Just based on what facts we have, it's not looking good.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: They don't seem like they'll attack us.

attributes.content: They're preventing us from entering. Deeply infected Sarkaz mercenaries in this area number around six, and seem to spend most of their time set to an unconscious roam.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Their range of movement doesn't extend outside this passage. These severely Infected collected here only after they picked up on our activity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Moreover, as long as we don't cross some boundary, they don't do anything further.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Reconnaissance operator. Can you detect our straight-line distance to the Sarcophagus? Determine position via the waveform I provided.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...1.4km. Precise figure?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...If my calculations aren't wrong, then the breakout of conflict between Reunion and Sarkaz special Infected happened to be roughly at distance 1.4km from the City Hall too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We initially planned to enter the Sarcophagus holding from the City Hall basement shelter passage, but as things are, that exit's likely been occupied by Sarkaz special Infected of the same kind.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I have an unconfirmed conjecture, Doctor...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We don't know what their goal is, but these Sarkaz special Infected are likely preventing anyone else from entering the sarcophagus holding, and by happy coincidence, this district they've controlled measures 1.4km out.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: You might be right, but what about their goal, then?

attributes.content: (Shakes her head)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: At the very least, it's not the same goal these Sarkaz originally had.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Poor Sarkaz, hailing from Kazdel. No matter where, they still become tools.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I believe there are similarities between the Infected and the Sarkaz's current situations. These Sarkaz here with us could only choose to well with hate, or to lose it all.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...Things were meant to have changed. We have that power.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Those Teekaz who lost their homeland—have become Sarkaz, rootless as people.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And now, the Sarkaz before us can barely even be called people.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: How do you want to do things?

attributes.content: All operators, inspect your hazmat equipment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: What we're facing may be a Class II Emergency Infective situation.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Doctor, in minimizing wear and tear to the utmost, we must halt the special Infected's activity to the utmost.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...We haven't stepped in to resolve an Emergency Infective state for a while. This outfit looks entirely like Ursus's Infected Patrol Unit.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There's something I can't deny—the hazmat equipment we've been provided with is emblematic of Ursus's cruel rule over the Infected... it shares the same prototypical design.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Though our approach is intrinsically distinct from the Infected Patrol Unit, I can only hope we're able to continue preserving that intrinsic difference—that outside forces don't force us to change beyond recognition.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The same hope we hold for so many things. Just like I told you about some time before. I hope you'll hope so too.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ————Was—Madame Ch'en here?
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Which way was he headed?
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: West. Stone's throw from the exclusion zone of Glowing Hoof.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: ...He plotted all of this. It was to ensure the area where we signed the pact was secure. Leithania expanded their contended exclusion zone, overlapping our own.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: We can infiltrate, kill Kashchey and bring back the Miss.
attributes.name: Shadow Guard

attributes.content: No. He's already prepared.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...In this meeting, the Twin Empresses directly dispatched the Empresses' Voice, and they weren't short of armed forces.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: The Empresses are fresh upon the throne. If Kashchey intends to blow our diplomacy apart, all our transgressive conduct may very well be the Empresses' excuse to flaunt their power.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: We can't give Kashchey more opportunities to harm Lungmen, or even Yen.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Uncle!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Hui-chieh...
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Uncle... it's not Tal's fault!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: I'm not blaming her.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...Then you should get mad at me.
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: You haven't done anything wrong.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I told her I was gonna go with her. But then I got scared... I... let go of her hand. I didn't go with her...
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: She looked... really scared. I was really scared, and she was too. I... I did something wrong.
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: ...Hui-chieh, she made the mistake, not you.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Huh? B-but you said you wouldn't blame her, Uncle!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: No, I won’t.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: But didn't... didn't she do something wrong? If she does something wrong, you're... not gonna get mad at her?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: She doesn't know the truth. It's not a truth anyone should be privy to, so of course she'd make a mistake. If not now, she would in the future.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...In so many cases, the wrong thing shouldn't be punished. Not only do we make mistakes, we'll make so many of them. If there's some mistake, we will make it. We can't dodge that, nor escape it.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Talulah simply made the mistake she was bound to.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Is that still doing something wrong, then?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Yes, of course it is. This world of ours wouldn't forgive something just because it was bound to happen.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: The world is harsh, the people are harsh, the regimes are harsh. Apart from right and wrong, they don't care a damn. As if it's right and wrong keeping them alive, and not what they breathe and swallow...!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I don't get what you're saying, Uncle.
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Does... does it mean Tal can still come back?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: —I don't know, Hui-chieh. I don't know.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...*sob*... Is it because of me... Tal won't come back? It's my fault... it's my fault... Tal...
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Hui-chieh!
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: *whimper*...!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Wipe your tears away.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Or cry, then. I'll give you five minutes. After you're done crying, if there's not still tears in your eyes, I'll tell you what you should do.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...Waaah...! Tal...!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Wei Yenwu gazes towards the sky. He considers bending down to comfort the tiny girl, but after hesitating, feels as if he isn’t suited to the task.
You're done crying, then.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: ...Mm-hm. I want Tal back. What should I do?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: I'll teach you a world of things. I'll teach you how to supervise a city, how to fend off villains, how to treat your friends.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Do as I say, and Talulah will have a chance of coming back.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Wh-what do I do? Will Tal be able to come back, really? Are you tricking me, Uncle?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: ...Mama... Mama said, you only know howta trick people. Can... can I really believe you?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Perhaps.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I've made a massive mistake of my own, and it led to your mother despising me for her whole life. Even on her deathbed, she couldn't have let go. What she told you is understandable.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: But mistakes can be made right.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Hui-chieh, listen carefully. Proper conduct is worth striving your whole life for. Correcting a mistake is worth putting life itself at stake for.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Talulah's departure was a mistake. Every consequence it brings, I will bear.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: And you, Hui-chieh. You'd better grow up fast.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: What'll it be like when I grow up?
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Hmm. When you grow up... you'll be able to change everything.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: Really?!
attributes.name: Ch'en Hui-chieh

attributes.content: Perhaps. Or let's put it this way: so long as you believe, it will be real.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: I'll teach you to wield a sword, Hui-chieh.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: To wield Chi Xiao.
attributes.name: Wei Yenwu

attributes.content: 'Unsheathing strike, eradicate without delay.'
